allowedOrigins.description: Lists the origins allowed to display the video. Enter allowed origin domains in an array and use `*` for wildcard subdomains. Empty arrays allow the video to be viewed on any origin.

created.description: The date and time the media item was created.

creator.description: A user-defined identifier for the media creator.

duration.description: The duration of the video in seconds. A value of `-1` means the duration is unknown. The duration becomes available after the upload and before the video is ready.

height.description: The video height in pixels. A value of `-1` means the height is unknown. The value becomes available after the upload and before the video is ready.

width.description: The video width in pixels. A value of `-1` means the width is unknown. The value becomes available after the upload and before the video is ready.

liveInput.description: The live input ID used to upload a video with Stream Live.

maxDurationSeconds.description: The maximum duration in seconds for a video upload. Can be set for a video that is not yet uploaded to limit its duration. Uploads that exceed the specified duration will fail during processing. A value of `-1` means the value is unknown.

meta.description: A user modifiable key-value store used to reference other systems of record for managing videos.

modified.description: The date and time the media item was last modified.

dash.description: DASH Media Presentation Description for the video.

hls.description: The HLS manifest for the video.

preview.description: The video's preview page URI. This field is omitted until encoding is complete.

readyToStream.description: Indicates whether the video is ready for viewing.

requireSignedURLs.description: Indicates whether the video can be a accessed using the UID. When set to `true`, a signed token must be generated with a signing key to view the video.

size.description: The size of the media item in bytes.

status.description: Specifies a detailed status for a video. If the `state` is `inprogress` or `error`, the `step` field returns `encoding` or `manifest`. If the `state` is `inprogress`, `pctComplete` returns a number between 0 and 100 to indicate the approximate percent of completion. If the `state` is `error`, `errorReasonCode` and `errorReasonText` provide additional details.

errorReasonCode.description: Specifies why the video failed to encode. This field is empty if the video is not in an `error` state. Preferred for programmatic use.

errorReasonText.description: Specifies why the video failed to encode using a human readable error message in English. This field is empty if the video is not in an `error` state.
errorReasonText.example: The file was not recognized as a valid video file.

pctComplete.description: Indicates the size of the entire upload in bytes. The value must be a non-negative integer.

state.description: Specifies the processing status of the video.

thumbnail.description: The media item's thumbnail URI. This field is omitted until encoding is complete.

thumbnailTimestampPct.description: The timestamp for a thumbnail image calculated as a percentage value of the video's duration. To convert from a second-wise timestamp to a percentage, divide the desired timestamp by the total duration of the video.  If this value is not set, the default thumbnail image is taken from 0s of the video.

uid.description: A Cloudflare-generated unique identifier for a media item.

uploadExpiry.description: The date and time when the video upload URL is no longer valid for direct user uploads.

uploaded.description: The date and time the media item was uploaded.

created.description: The date and a time a watermark profile was created.

downloadedFrom.description: The source URL for a downloaded image. If the watermark profile was created via direct upload, this field is null.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels.

name.description: A short description of the watermark profile.

opacity.description: The translucency of the image. A value of `0.0` makes the image completely transparent, and `1.0` makes the image completely opaque. Note that if the image is already semi-transparent, setting this to `1.0` will not make the image completely opaque.

padding.description: The whitespace between the adjacent edges (determined by position) of the video and the image. `0.0` indicates no padding, and `1.0` indicates a fully padded video width or length, as determined by the algorithm.

position.description: The location of the image. Valid positions are: `upperRight`, `upperLeft`, `lowerLeft`, `lowerRight`, and `center`. Note that `center` ignores the `padding` parameter.

scale.description: The size of the image relative to the overall size of the video. This parameter will adapt to horizontal and vertical videos automatically. `0.0` indicates no scaling (use the size of the image as-is), and `1.0 `fills the entire video.

size.description: The size of the image in bytes.

uid.description: The unique identifier for a watermark profile.

width.description: The width of the image in pixels.
